page.title: 09THE VILLAGE NOT SO LONG AGO
page.content: Mrs. E.L. Hiam tells us that in the 1890's Hartpury had its own tradespeople and provided its own entertainment. At the Methodist Chapel Treat the Sunday School children sang and carried banners around the village, finishing with tea, games and fireworks. Also annually, the men followed a band around the village returning to the Canning Arms for the Hartpury Feast - the rest enjoyed the roundabouts and stalls in the field opposite. Mr. A. Finch and Mrs. A.D. Underwood remember the first 'bus', in the 1920's, was a lorry with seats run by Mr. Travell to Gloucester for 3d. Most people travelled around on bicycles. The improvements in transport encourage people to seek employment in Gloucester, as well as visiting other villagers some distance away for dances.
